alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Greensville; Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Northampton, Greensville, southwestern Southampton, south central Sussex and southeastern Brunswick Counties and the City of Emporia through 145 PM EDT... At 100 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brunswick to near Dahlia to near Halifax. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Dahlia around 110 PM EDT. Claresville and Radium around 125 PM EDT. Green Plain around 130 PM EDT. Emporia around 135 PM EDT. Purdy around 140 PM EDT. Conway around 145 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Milwaukee, Adams Grove, Grizzard, Bufford Crossroads, Lanes Corner, Pleasant Shade, Bryants Corner, Jackson, Slates Corner and Emporia Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
